thread.title: Homeless man 'raped and beat heavily pregnant woman breaking jaw and elbow after she helped put up tent'
thread.title_full: Homeless man 'raped and beat heavily pregnant woman breaking jaw and elbow after she helped put up tent'

author: Geoff Bennett
title: Homeless man 'raped and beat heavily pregnant woman breaking jaw and elbow after she helped put up tent'
text:
Homeless man 'raped and beat heavily pregnant woman breaking jaw and elbow after she helped put up tent' Jonathan Wade, 27, denies rape, sexual assault and inflicting grievous bodily harm on the woman Share Jonathan Wade, 27, denies rape and beating the woman in a tent in August (Photo: SWNS) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A homeless man raped a heavily pregnant woman who helped him to put up his tent, a court heard. 
Jonathan Wade took drugs and drank wine before imprisoning the woman in his rent and raping her, she later told police . 
He also broke her jaw and elbow during the violent attack in Victoria Park, Windmill Hill, Bristol Crown Court heard. 
Wade, 27, whose address was given as care of Preacher Close in St George, denies rape, sexual assault and inflicting grievous bodily harm on the woman. 
She was about seven-and-a-half months pregnant at the time of the attack in August last year, reports the Bristol Post . 
Virginia Cornwall, prosecuting, said: "He forcefully put himself upon her, licked her vagina and inflicted grievous bodily harm. Victoria Park, where the woman alleges the attack took place (Photo: SWNS) 
"He was responsible for causing two fractures, to her jaw and elbow. 
"She was 33 weeks' pregnant at the time." 
Miss Cornwall described how the woman helped Wade but he wouldn't let her leave. 
After raping her, he appeared to be remorseful and wanted forgiveness, the jury was told. 
The woman told police: "I was just about to leave. He dragged me into his tent. He proper snapped at me. 
"He pushed me back down, he did the tent up and he wouldn't let me go. 
"He laid me down and just held me. He wouldn't let me go. He was drinking. 
"He just started touching me up. I said I didn't want to do this. I wanted to go home." 
The woman told officers she punched Wade but he punched her before he forced himself on her, then fell asleep. 
She was then able to call for help, she said. 
Miss Cornwall told the jury the woman used her phone to message for help and police were called, tracking down the woman and Wade after searching the area by helicopter. 
The case continues.
